problems.title: Job Sequencing with Deadlines
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N jobs. Each job has:
- A deadline (latest day by which it must be completed)
- A profit (earned if the job is completed on time)

Each job takes exactly 1 day to complete.
You can do at most one job per day.

Find the maximum profit you can earn by scheduling jobs.

Greedy Strategy: Prioritize high-profit jobs and schedule them as late as possible before their deadline.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
4 20
1 10
1 40
1 30

Sample Output
60

Explanation:
Jobs (deadline, profit): [(4,20), (1,10), (1,40), (1,30)]
Sorted by profit (desc): [(1,40), (1,30), (4,20), (1,10)]

- Job (1,40): Schedule on day 1 → Profit = 40
- Job (1,30): Day 1 taken, deadline passed → Skip
- Job (4,20): Schedule on day 4 (or 3,2) → Profit = 40 + 20 = 60
- Job (1,10): Day 1 taken → Skip

Maximum Profit = 60
